It was moved, seconded and accepted that the Executive Committee
authorize the preparation of a resolution which would be directed
to its concern that the professional staff of the Association
be informed of the Committee’s understanding of its responsibility
for their welfare, and that the Committee commit itself to a
continuation of professional services for institutions and
individuals, across media, across divisions, in any way possible,
and that the staff be directed to recommend alternatives which
would make it possible to accomplish such services. (Breitenfeld/
Harrison)

AUTHORIZATIONS
The following resolutions were approved in order to update
bank authorizations transferring signature authority from Mr.
Hough to Mr. Richards:
For NAEB General Fund Account:
’’Resolved: That Ray J. Richards, Jr., the Treasurer of
the National Association of Educational Broadcasters is
authorized and instructed to continue a depost account
for and in the name of this corporation or organization
with the National Bank of Washington, to deposit therein
funds of the corporation or organization and that said
account may be drawn on only by check signed in the name
of this corporation or organization by one of the
following: President, Treasurer, Vice-President and
Secretary and countersigned by one of the following:
President, Treasurer, Vice-President and Secretary."
(Harrison/Macandrew)
For NAEB Payroll Account:
"Resolved: That Ray J. Richards, Jr., the Treasurer of
the National Association of Educational Broadcasters is
authorized and instructed to continue a deposit account
for and in the name of this corporation or organization
with the National Bank of Washington, to deposit therein
funds of the corporation or organization and that said
account may be drawn on only by check signed in the name
of this corporation or organization by one of the follow¬
ing: President, Treasurer, and Vice-President."
(Breintenfeld/Macandrew)
